title: Biology
description: Cells, genetics, and basic life processes.

questions.prompt: What is the basic unit of life?
questions.explanation: Cells are the smallest units that can carry out all processes needed for life.

questions.prompt: Mitochondria are often called the “powerhouses” of the cell because they…
choices: Produce much of the cell’s ATP energy
questions.explanation: Mitochondria generate energy for cells, packaged as ATP.

questions.prompt: DNA is the molecule that primarily…
questions.explanation: DNA stores genetic information used for development and functioning of organisms.

questions.prompt: DNA is shaped like a…
questions.explanation: DNA is made of two strands that wind around each other like a twisted ladder (a double helix).

questions.prompt: Ribosomes are the cell structures that…
questions.explanation: Ribosomes assemble amino acids into proteins (translation).

questions.prompt: During photosynthesis, plants take in…
questions.explanation: Photosynthesis uses carbon dioxide and water (with light) to build sugars and release oxygen.

questions.prompt: Photosynthesis happens mainly in which cell organelle?
questions.explanation: In plants and algae, photosynthesis occurs in chloroplasts.

questions.prompt: Proteins are built from smaller units called…
questions.explanation: Amino acids are linked together to form proteins.

questions.prompt: The cell membrane is important because it…
choices: Controls what enters and leaves the cell
questions.explanation: Cell membranes are selectively permeable, helping maintain a stable internal environment.

questions.prompt: Homeostasis refers to an organism’s ability to…
questions.explanation: Homeostasis is regulation that keeps internal conditions within a workable range (e.g., temperature, pH).

questions.prompt: How many chromosomes do humans typically have in most body cells?
questions.explanation: Humans typically have 46 chromosomes (23 pairs) in somatic cells.

questions.prompt: In most plants, roots mainly…
questions.explanation: Roots anchor the plant and absorb water and dissolved nutrients from the soil.

questions.prompt: Cell theory states that…
choices: All living things are made of cells
Cells are only found in animals
Cells form only in the oceans
questions.explanation: A core idea is that organisms are composed of cells, the basic unit of life.

questions.prompt: Natural selection is…
choices: Differential survival and reproduction of individuals with heritable traits
A way organisms choose their traits
A change that happens instantly in all individuals
questions.explanation: Traits affecting survival/reproduction can become more common over generations.

questions.prompt: Mitosis mainly produces…
choices: A single cell with double DNA forever
questions.explanation: Mitosis is cell division for growth and repair, producing identical cells.

questions.prompt: Meiosis is important because it…
choices: Produces gametes with half the chromosome number
questions.explanation: Meiosis makes haploid gametes and increases genetic variation.

questions.prompt: Enzymes are best described as…
choices: Biological catalysts that speed up reactions
questions.explanation: Enzymes lower activation energy, increasing reaction rates.

questions.prompt: An ecosystem includes…
choices: Organisms and their physical environment interacting
Only the climate of a region
questions.explanation: Ecosystems include living communities and non-living factors interacting.

questions.prompt: A common difference between RNA and DNA is that RNA usually…
choices: Is single-stranded and uses uracil instead of thymine
questions.explanation: RNA often is single-stranded and uses uracil (U) where DNA uses thymine (T).

questions.prompt: Antibodies are produced by…
questions.explanation: B cells can differentiate into plasma cells that secrete antibodies.
